page.title: 18A Day in the Life
page.content: It is 7.30 am, time to get up for school. I walk into the kitchen of our house in Surrenden Road. Wearily I pour some Shreddies into my cereal bowl and add some skimmed milk. Then after getting ready, I start the short walk to school at 8.30 which is roughly a 1,000 metres, meeting friends on the way. When I arrive at school, I go straight to my classroom and attend registration, when we have some extra time before lessons start. The first three lessons of French, Latin and Music quickly pass and breaktime starts at 11.00am. The next two lessons pass slowly and an hour's lunchbreak starts at 12.30pm. At 1.30 lessons are resumed and I half heaatedly rush to art. When I finish school I go to Brighton seafront. I spend 50p on a few arcade machines and a currant bun.
